com.ozdevworx.util
Class ListArray

java.lang.Object
  com.ozdevworx.util.LaGetter
      com.ozdevworx.util.ListArray
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataHandler
public class ListArray
extends LaGetter
implements DataHandler

Access DataHandler Data via a String label or a numeric index.
A DataHandler is an Object itself so support for mutidimensional DataHandler Objects is generic to this imlementation.

This DataHandler implementation uses synchronization as specified by the DataHandler interface.

The core abstract implentation for this DataHandler implementation is ArrayList.
We are using dual synchronized ArrayList's that work in strict unison to maintain data integrity and maximise the flexibility and dynamics of this Data Type.
ArrayList is one of the better performing List implementations. The synchronization abilities of the ArrayList's is handled by this class as ArrayList is not a synchronized Object in itself.

Version:
1.0.0.6
Author:
Tim Gall (Oz-DevWorX)

Constructor Summary
ListArray()
          Create a case sensitive DataHandler of initial capacity 10.
Initial capacity is 10 with an expansion rate of 10 when the DataHandler is growing.
Empty place holders are ignored when manipulating and querying data.

EG:
length() returns the actual size and does not include placeholders related to this DataHandlers growth rate.
isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.
ListArray(boolean lowerCaseKeys)
          Create a case insensitive DataHandler of initial capacity incSize.
Initial capacity is 10 with an expansion rate of 10 when the DataHandler is growing.
Empty place holders are ignored when manipulating and querying data.

EG:
getSize() returns the actual Element count and does not include placeholders related to this DataHandlers growth rate.
isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.

isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.

ListArray

public ListArray()
Create a case sensitive DataHandler of initial capacity 10.
Initial capacity is 10 with an expansion rate of 10 when the DataHandler is growing.
Empty place holders are ignored when manipulating and querying data.

EG:
length() returns the actual size and does not include placeholders related to this DataHandlers growth rate.
isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.

ListArray

public ListArray(int incSize)
Create a case sensitive DataHandler of initial capacity incSize.
Initial capacity is incSize with an expansion rate of incSize when the DataHandler is growing.
Empty place holders are ignored when manipulating and querying data.

EG:
getSize() returns the actual Element count and does not include placeholders related to this DataHandlers growth rate.
isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.

Parameters:
incSize - int. This value affects the initial size and the expansion rate when the DataHandler is growing.

ListArray

public ListArray(boolean lowerCaseKeys)
Create a case insensitive DataHandler of initial capacity incSize.
Initial capacity is 10 with an expansion rate of 10 when the DataHandler is growing.
Empty place holders are ignored when manipulating and querying data.

EG:
getSize() returns the actual Element count and does not include placeholders related to this DataHandlers growth rate.
isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.

Parameters:
lowerCaseKeys - boolean. If true, keys all use lower case, if false keys all use upper case.

ListArray

public ListArray(int incSize,
                 boolean lowerCaseKeys)
Create a case insensitive DataHandler of initial capacity incSize.
Initial capacity is incSize with an expansion rate of incSize when the DataHandler is growing.
Empty place holders are ignored when manipulating and querying data.

EG:
getSize() returns the actual Element count and does not include placeholders related to this DataHandlers growth rate.
isEmpty() does not count placeholders, only actual Elements that were added to the DataHandler.
etc.

Parameters:
incSize - int. This value affects the initial size and the expansion rate when the DataHandler is growing.
lowerCaseKeys - boolean. If true, keys all use lower case, if false keys all use upper case.
